title: Lore Question : Currency
body:
Anyone know the different currencies of the regions:
i already know that the golden kraken is the highest form of currency in bilgewater and that "gears" are used in Piltover                                               (deduced from "the vastayan journal). Any others that you guys would know of?

replies.body:
I could imagine gold pieces would be the standard form of currency, whereas certain areas could vary, like you say so.
Like the Golden Kraken, or a different form of currency useless anywhere else in Runeterra just makes sense for a smugglers haven.
I'm not sure, but I'd dare say gold is mostly the standard until said otherwise.

It's very possible they have something similar to the dollar, in the sense that many places use the 'dollar' as their currency but what kind of dollar it is gives it different value (eg. AUD vs NZD). In our case that value is determined by some deep economics stuff that I would have little hope of understanding let alone explaining, but back in the day that value was determined (primarily) by composition.

1 'gold' with a gram of actual gold in it is going to be worth less than 1 'gold' with 5g of gold in it. Where the currency comes from would likely determines that. Of course they may well just use gold itself as the currency depending on how relatively abundant it is and how easy it is to trade.

Following either precedent it makes sense for places renowned for less than savoury folk to have a form of currency that is easy to verify and difficult to counterfeit because otherwise it essentially has no value.

But trade being a valuable currency in it's own right, a place like Piltover using things like parts as a sort of secondary currency is not surprising, like how salt or silk were basically a currency of their own at some points in history.
